reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the collection of data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that data is collected by the app when users input their data, and it mentions the types of data collected.
reply.reference: If you do not consent, then you must not use the App. Aggregated Data We may anonymise and aggregate data from all users of the App. This data may be derived from your personal data but is not considered personal data in law as this data will not directly or indirectly reveal your identity. For example, we may aggregate your age, ethnicity, health and lifestyle data, but without your name, address or contact details. URL: https://www.reachwell.info/privacy.html, Information you give us. This is information (including Identity, Health and Lifestyle, Biological, Data about your contacts, and Communications Data) you consent to giving us about you by filling in forms on the URL: https://www.reachwell.info/privacy.html

Privacy Notice
Introduction
This policy (together with any additional terms of use notified to you) apply to your use of our REACHHealth web application (App). It applies whether you access the App by our website or by downloading and using the dedicated mobile application software.
This policy also applies to any services accessible through the App or that are available on any websites of ours (Services) unless a separate policy is notified to you when accessing or using those Services.
This po...

of our website.
For more detailed information on how we use cookies, see our cookie policy
If you are using the mobile application software, we use your mobile device's built-in storage to store small pieces of data, similar to how cookies work in a browser. This information is generally stored indefinitely, to allow us to provide you the best possible experience. We do this to keep you authenticated to our servers, store data for easy retrieval later, and track the performance of the app.
For d...

them with third parties.
How is your personal data collected?
We will collect and process the following data about you:

Information you give us. This is information (including Identity, Health and Lifestyle, Biological, Data about your contacts, and Communications Data) you consent to giving us about you by filling in forms on the App or our websites, or by corresponding with us (for example, by email or chat). It includes information you provide when you register to use the App or any Service...

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects Identity Data (name, username, date of birth, biological sex), Contact Data (email address), Ethnicity, Biological Data (age, height, weight, heart rate, blood pressure, blood glucose, cholesterol), Health and Lifestyle Data, Device Data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly outlines the various types of personal data that the app collects from users.
reply.reference: Identity Data, Contact Data, Ethnicity, Biological Data, Health and Lifestyle Data, Device Data. URL: https://www.reachwell.info/privacy.html

reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the purpose of data collection and use.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the app collects information on lifestyle, health, and wellbeing to calculate risk factors for diseases and provide advice on managing those risk factors.
reply.reference: One of the main purposes of the App is to collect information on your lifestyle and health and wellbeing, in order to calculate your risk factors for specific diseases and provide advice on how to manage those risk factors. URL: https://www.reachwell.info/privacy.html

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of data collection or delete data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy explicitly states that users can withdraw consent at any time by closing their account, deleting their data, and contacting the data controller through email. Moreover, it mentions that users have the right to request erasure of their personal data, indicating that users can indeed opt out of data collection or delete their data.
reply.reference: You may withdraw your consent at any time by closing your account, and choosing to delete your data, from the profile section of the App. You can also contact us at [email protected]. URL: https://www.reachwell.info/privacy.html.

This information is not personal data.

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app shares data with third parties.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the app shares personal data with various third parties under specific circumstances.
reply.reference: We will share your personal data with the third parties set out below - Your contacts, when you take part in team challenges and tasks, or when you agree to share data with your contacts in the App. In these cases, we will share your activity data relating to the specific challenge or task. - Other members of our group of companies - Service providers acting as processors based in the United Kingdom who provide IT and system administration services. - Third parties to whom we may choose to sell, transfer or merge parts of our business or our assets. Alternatively, we may seek to acquire other businesses or merge with them. If a change happens to our business, then the new owners may use your personal data in the same way as set out in this privacy policy. For any marketing purposes. URL: https://www.reachwell.info/privacy.html

reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: The app shares data with the user's contacts, other members of the company group, service providers, and potential business partners.

content: Other members of the company group

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states the different categories of third parties with whom the app shares data
reply.reference: Your contacts, when you take part in team challenges and tasks, or when you agree to share data with your contacts in the App. In these cases, we will share your activity data relating to the specific challenge or task. Other members of our group of companies. Service providers acting as processors based in the United Kingdom who provide IT and system administration services. Third parties to whom we may choose to sell, transfer, or merge parts of our business or our assets. Alternatively, we may seek to acquire other businesses or merge with them. If a change happens to our business, then the new owners may use your personal data in the same way as set out in this privacy policy. URL: https://www.reachwell.info/privacy.html
